lady.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a woman of a particular type or age
lady.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a word meaning woman, used especially to describe women’s sports or products made for women
lady.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a word meaning woman, used in order to be polite
lady doctor/lawyer etc (=a doctor, lawyer etc who is a woman. Some women think this use is offensive)
lady.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: The young lady at reception sent me up here.
Give your coat to the lady over there.
lady.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a woman who is polite and behaves very well
lady.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: She knows how to behave like a lady.
lady.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a woman, especially one with a strong character – used to show approval
lady.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: She can be a tough lady to negotiate with.
lady.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: used when talking directly to a woman you do not know, when you are angry with her
lady.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: Hey, lady, would you mind getting out of my way?
lady.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: a woman born into a high social class in Britain
lady.translation[0].definitions[6].examp: I could see the Queen, surrounded by her lords and ladies.
lady.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: used as the title of the wife or daughter of a British nobleman or the wife of a knight
lady.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: a rather old-fashioned British magazine for women, typically read by older, upper-class women. It also contains advertisements for servants and nannies(nanny).
